channel.title: File Transfer on Tech Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in File Transfer on Tech Notebook

item.title: Netcat: File Transfer
item.description:
Introduction link

Netcat (nc) is a “…simple Unix utility which reads and writes data across network connections, using TCP or UDP protocol. It is designed to be a reliable back-end tool that can be used directly or easily driven by other programs and scripts. At the same time, it is a feature-rich network debugging and exploration tool, since it can create almost any kind of connection you would need and has several interesting built-in capabilities.”

item.title: FTP: Automate Transfers
item.description:
Introduction link

It’s sometimes convenient to automate certain tasks like uploading files or other operations.

FTP link

With the universal ftp command, here’s an example that you can place in a shell script:

 transfertFile()
{
 inputFile=$1
 
 ftp -n <<end
 prompt
 open $Hostname $Port
 user $Login $Password
 ascii
 put $inputFile
 bye
end
}

NCFTP link

With the ncftp utility, it’s even simpler since it works with just one line:

item.title: MySecureShell: Setting up a Secure File Transfer Solution
item.description:
Introduction link

It was about time this documentation arrived! Although I am one of the founders and developers of MySecureShell, creating a quick and simpler guide than the one on the website was a bit daunting. But I finally found this magnificent documentation.
